Package ohos.aafwk.abilityjet.databinding

Class DataBindingUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.aafwk.abilityjet.databinding.DataBindingUtil

  • public class DataBindingUtil
extends Object
    A utility class of DataBinding that obtains DataBinding objects.

    You can define attributes of the class to be bound in a layout file. After compilation, the corresponding DataBinding child class will be automatically generated. You can call the createBinding(int,ohos.app.Context,java.lang.String) method to obtain the generated DataBinding child class object for further initialization and binding.

    Since:
    1
    See Also:
    DataBinding
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Aafwk#ABILITYJET

    • Method Detail

      • createBinding

        public static <T extends DataBinding> T createBinding​(int layoutId,
                                                      Context context)
                                               throws IOException
        Obtains the declared DataBinding object based on the given layout file ID and Context object.

        You must specify a valid layout file ID and Context object as the input parameters. Otherwise, this method will throw an exception.

        Parameters:
        layoutId - Indicates the ID of the resource layout file.
        context - Indicates the application context.
        Returns:
        Returns the DataBinding child class object if one has been declared; returns null otherwise.
        Throws:
        IOException - Throws this exception if the specified resource layout file fails to be accessed.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if a parameter value is invalid.
        Since:
        4

      • createBinding

        public static <T extends DataBinding> T createBinding​(int layoutId,
                                                      Context context,
                                                      String packageName)
                                               throws IOException
        Obtains the declared DataBinding object based on the given layout file ID, Context object, and HAP package name.

        You must specify a valid layout file ID, Context object, and HAP package name as the input parameters. Otherwise, this method will throw an exception.

        Parameters:
        layoutId - Indicates the ID of the resource layout file.
        context - Indicates the application context.
        packageName - Indicates the package name of the specified HAP (module).
        Returns:
        Returns the DataBinding child class object if one has been declared; returns null otherwise.
        Throws:
        IOException - Throws this exception if the specified resource layout file fails to be accessed.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if a parameter value is invalid.
        Since:
        5
